benchmark_details.name: Cholera X Emotion Classification Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The study aims to classify emotions expressed in social media posts about Cholera based on a dataset of 23,000 tweets, utilizing machine learning models for emotion classification.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To classify emotions in social media posts related to Cholera outbreaks.

data.source: Collected tweets from the Twitter API using related hashtags.
data.annotation: Emotion labeling using the pysentimiento library based on Ekman's basic wheel of emotions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard definitions for classification problems.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 Score indicate effective emotion classification.
methodology.baseline_results: LSTM achieved an accuracy of 76%, Logistic Regression achieved 60%, Decision Tree achieved 56%, and BERT achieved 66%.
methodology.validation: The dataset was split into 80% training and 20% testing.
